page.title: 01UNSTONE & NEW WHITTINGTON
page.content: This block takes in the districts of Sheepbridge, Unstone Green, Hallowes, St. John's Road, Hundall, West Handley & parts of New & Old Whittington. It borders Chesterfield to the south & Dronfield to the north. Occupied in Mesolithic times about 10,000 years ago, a manor at the time of the first Domesday Survey in 1086, the area now contains about 1200 houses, 70 factories, 8 churches, 6 schools, part of the A61 Derby to Thirsk trunk road & the Sheffield to London main line railway. Still largely rural with much development dating since 1945. The old industries of coal mining, iron and edge-tool manufacture have largely vanished and lighter trades taken their place. Part of Derbyshire's "Green Belt",development restricted.
